data.title: BOWL - The Bowling News
data.text: Our 56th Year VOL. 56, NO. 1 www.TheBowlingNews.net JANUARY 5, 2012 Inside: SASBA Annual Awards SASBA’s annual awards were presented December 17th. Page 2 NABI Results Jones takes 4th title at AMF Richardson. Page 2 SASBA Tour plans for 2012 Page 13 Why I love the sport of bowling By Del Ballard. Page 9 Hooker Classic results Kris Prather takes the 5th annual Hooker Classic at Northrock. Page 17 Features Honor Roll Page 3 Off the Sheet By Clint Dacy Page 4 Last Call w/Leisha By Leisha Murr Page 7 Looking Back Page 10 Up Your Average By Susie Minshew Page 11 Tomorrow’s Stars Page 12-13 Sponsored by Classic Products Lane Laughter Page 13 Loving Left-Handedness By Aaron Walsh Page 19 Wright in the Heart of Texas By Don Wright Page 24 PRESORTED STD U.S. POSTAGE PAID ARLINGTON, TX PERMIT NO. 419 USBC announces executive-level promotions Oil Capital Open moving to and restructuring spring 2012 The 41st Annual Oil Capital ARLINGTON, Texas – United States Bowling Congress Executive Director Stu Upson announced he will expand and restructure the USBC executive team, promoting three staff members to newly-created roles. The changes will be effective January 1, 2012, and include a position designed to Website Video View videos at www.TheBowlingNews.net See Del Ballard take a run at perfection Video of Del attempting to shoot his first sanctioned 300 game in a very long time. It was shot in the Masters league at AMF Showplace Euless Lanes on December 15th. Video starts in the eighth frame and has an exciting finish to say the least. Plus check for bonus footage of Terry Taylor. Rash talks about WSOB success Sean Rash interviewed by Genie Franklin. The interview takes place after he had qualified for 6 TV Shows. Watch as he explains how he found such extraordinary success in the World Series of Bowling. Josh Blanchard This Sunday on ESPN, former Wichita State University bowler Josh Blanchard, takes on Jason Belmonte, Brian Kretzer and Mike Fagan in the PBA World Championship Mike Aulby Division Finals. Visit www. thebowlingnews.net to view Blanchard’s video and hear him talk about his strategy for the upcoming match. oversee logistics and operations of USBC programs. Eric Kearney will assume the role of Managing Director of Operations and Administration, Mike Spridco is promoted to Managing Director of Rules and Association Services and Jason Overstreet will become Managing Director of Communications. Kearney, who recently earned his master’s degree in business administration, now will oversee operations and project management for the organization in addition to his duties managing diversity, education, affinity relationships and staffing of the International Bowling Museum and Hall of Fame. “Improving USBC’s organizational efficiency needs to be a key priority,” Upson said. “Eric has proven his ability to manage complex projects, making him a great fit for this role.” Spridco will continue to manage USBC’s rules and bonding department, while gaining new oversight related to association operations. Overstreet continues his responsibility overseeing public relations and publications and will play a major role in USBC’s live streaming initiative. “Expanding our executive team will bring new perspective to the leadership group,” Upson said. “It also allows for more executive focus on some of our most important programs.” As part of the restructuring, Pete Tredwell’s role will change to Managing Director of Media and Events. Tredwell will continue to manage BOWL.com and video production, while adding oversight of USBC Convention and several short-duration tournaments, including the USBC Masters and Queens. Chad Murphy’s title will become International Bowling Campus Managing Director of Youth Development, reporting to both Upson and Bowling Proprietors’ Association of America Executive Director Steve Johnson. TOURNAMENT NEWS AND UPDATES Open has been moved from its familiar spot in the fall to its new time in the spring. The tournament will run on weekends from March 31st to May 6th 2012 at AMF Sheridan Lanes in Tulsa, OK. Tournament Director Jim Adams said, “We are hopeful that we will have more success at this time of the year, previously the event has gone up against the Greater Tulsa Open. Our District Manager wanted to try a different time and separate the two tournaments.” “The best thing about our tournament is the longevity, this is the 41st year, we take As I read back through old issues of The Bowling News, I find that every week there were one or two tournaments that paid over $1000 for first place. What happened, where did all of these good paying tournaments go? Well of course we know there are tons of reasons why that is, but the important thing is to try and get them back. John Reger is on a mission to do just that, “When I first started bowling, Jim Welch was around and ran the tournaments, then when I came back, Welch was in Vegas and there was a void of tournaments to bowl, so I wanted to Jim Adams, Tournament Director care of the people, and the event always runs smooth,” Continued on Page 17 Big money tournament coming back to the Metroplex By Tony Franklin The 78th annual Southwest Tournament entries are now in the mail, with the event running on weekends from February 18th & 19th – March 24th & 25th. For the 7th consecutive year, the tournament will be held at Northrock Lanes in Wichita, KS. The Host hotel for the event will be North Rock Suites at 36th & North Rock Rd., they can be reached John Reger fill that void. The experiences I had with the big money Track Continued on Page 26 Southwest Tournament entries going out at 316-634-2303. As always, the tournament will consist of Team, Doubles, and Singles events with separate Open and Women’s divisions. The entry is $22 per event and the handicap is 80% of 220. There is also a separate scratch all events entry that costs $10 to enter with 100% being returned to the prize fund. You are also allowed to Continued on Page 10
